metadata.Title: CVE-2011-5035 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description:
Oracle Glassfish 2.1.1, 3.0.1, and 3.1.1, as used in Communications Server2.0, Sun Java System Application Server 8.1 and 8.2, and possibly otherproducts, computes hash values for form parameters without restricting theability to trigger hash collisions predictably, which allows remoteattackers to cause a denial of service (CPU consumption) by sending manycrafted parameters, aka Oracle security ticket S0104869.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2011-5035` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

icedtea-6-jre-cacao - 6b24-1.11.1-0ubuntu1
icedtea-6-jre-jamvm - 6b24-1.11.1-0ubuntu1
openjdk-6-demo - 6b24-1.11.1-0ubuntu1
openjdk-6-jdk - 6b24-1.11.1-0ubuntu1
openjdk-6-jre - 6b24-1.11.1-0ubuntu1
openjdk-6-jre-headless - 6b24-1.11.1-0ubuntu1
openjdk-6-jre-lib - 6b24-1.11.1-0ubuntu1
openjdk-6-jre-zero - 6b24-1.11.1-0ubuntu1
openjdk-6-source - 6b24-1.11.1-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

icedtea-7-jre-jamvm - 7~u3-2.1-1ubuntu1
openjdk-7-demo - 7~u3-2.1-1ubuntu1
openjdk-7-jdk - 7~u3-2.1-1ubuntu1
openjdk-7-jre - 7~u3-2.1-1ubuntu1
openjdk-7-jre-headless - 7~u3-2.1-1ubuntu1
openjdk-7-jre-lib - 7~u3-2.1-1ubuntu1
openjdk-7-jre-zero - 7~u3-2.1-1ubuntu1
openjdk-7-source - 7~u3-2.1-1ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: openjdk-6 package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '6b24-1.11.1-0ubuntu1').
openjdk-7 package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '7~u3-2.1-1ubuntu1').
